column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////It's my first time in Chicago and I was really excited to have an authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. The concierge at my hotel recommended Lou's to me so I gave it a shot... now I'm sadly very disappointed. With tax
column2: tip and delivery fees my large pizza was $40
column3: but the flavor/quality was not good. It's heavy
column4: bland and the crust itself was not very good. I don't even want to eat the rest of it
column5: I'm just going to throw it away. This was a wasted experience. Also
column6: for $40 I could have had a much better outing somewhere else.
